programme.title: Lions On The Move
programme.desc: Kevin Richardson shares an extraordinary bond with Africa’s most fearsome predators. Together with them, he has experienced some real adventures. However, transporting 27 lions and 14 hyenas to a new home presents a different challenge.The lions new home will be a sanctuary on the edge of Dinokeng, a South African game reserve spanning 18,000 square metres. The huge task ahead includes planning and designing the new enclosures, and securing permits to move the animals.

programme.title: Cuba to Go
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Cuba to Go - Episode 1
programme.desc: Ever since the embargo was lifted in the summer of 2015, Cuba’s popularity has been steadily increasing.

programme.title: Cuba to Go
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Cuba to Go - Episode 2
programme.desc: Ever since the embargo was lifted in the summer of 2015, Cuba’s popularity has been steadily increasing.

programme.title: Cuba - Brilliantly Caribbean
programme.desc: Even anyone who has not yet been to Cuba can conjure up certain images of American vintage street cruisers, imposing buildings that have seen better days, white sandy beaches full of palms and loving couples on the Malecon against a backdrop of crashing waves. This island is somewhat of a myth and its people generate a special joie de vivre. The legendary Hershey Train departs for Matanzas from the capital, Havana. On the oldest electrified railway line in the Caribbean, 60-year-old Spanish carriages make their way along al-most 100 kilometres of coastline in the most relaxed way possible. The Salvavidas on Varadero, probably the most famous beach on the island, have a particular-ly...

programme.title: mareTV: Martinique
programme.desc: The island of Martinique is a piece of France in the Caribbean, between Florida and South America. And of course, Savoir-vivre applies just as it does on the other side of the Atlantic, between the English Channel and the Mediterranean. Jacky Pascault is the first and only man to cultivate mushrooms in the Caribbean. Everywhere else, they grow on artificially fertilised soil, but Jackys Champignons Tropicaux flourish on sugar cane fibres. Nicole Vilo tailors hats and dresses out of coconut palms. Of course, the catwalk for the models wearing her first collection is one of the countless dream beaches. The Martiniquais sail on boats they call Yole, which have no keel and are therefore...

programme.title: mareTV: Curacao, Blue Wonder of the Caribbean
programme.desc: Curacao is one of the most popular attractions for countless cruise ships on their trips through the Caribbean, because it is located outside of the hurricane belt. This is why Eric Miguel is constantly in action. He is the bridge keeper of the Queen Emma Bridge, the landmark of Curacaos capital, Willemstad. After his shift, Eric goes to Yvonne Troemans cook-shop. Her speciality is Kadushi, a cactus soup. The ingredients include cactus flesh, pigtails, mussels and a few secret "treats". Barbara van Bebber is the only submarine pilot on Curacao and literally gets to the bottom of things amidst the turquoise-blue wonder of the Caribbean. She charters out her sub to marine biologists and...

programme.title: mareTV: Madeira - Portugals sea of blossoms in the Atlantic Ocean
programme.desc: Flower magic in Madeira: The Flower Festival Festa da Flor is the most important event of the year for the people of the Atlantic island. With it they celebrate spring, which is climatically practically all year round here, their island and themselves. The coast formed by lava, centuries-old laurel forests and green steep slopes make Madeira unique. Those who start right at the front of the big parade of the flower festival in the capital Funchal, will have made it. For Isabel Borges this dream has come true. She opens this years flower parade along the harbour promenade with her festive group. This accolade does not only mean fame and prestige, but also a lot of pressure. Are the...

programme.title: mareTV: Tenerife - The Queen of the Canaries
programme.desc: Tenerife is outstanding among the Canary Islands. If only because of the volcano Pico del Teide, which rises exactly 3.718 meters above sea level and is thus the highest mountain in Spain. But not only scenically Tenerife, the largest of the Canary Islands, stands out...

programme.title: Fuerteventura: The golden beauty of the Canaries
programme.desc: Fuerteventura, the second largest of the Canary Islands, is located just 120 kilometres off the coast of West Africa. The climate is extremely dry and the struggle for water has always been a major setback. Then, around a century ago, returning US emigrants brought what were then modern wind turbine water pumps from the Aermotor Windmill Company with them to Fuerte-ventura. Today, the environmentally friendly and so-called “Chicago’s”, experience a renaissance. Unfortu-nately, original spare parts in good condition are diffi-cult to come by. When Leocadio Araya Sanchez began planting countless cacti on a barren hillside a few years ago, people thought he was mad. His idea was to make a...

programme.title: Dream Islands of Europe: Lanzarote and Fuerteventura
programme.desc: The film presents the two Canary Islands Lanzarote and Fuerteventura. Lanzarote has a rich culture in addition to a volcanic landscape: the film accompanies a ceramic artist, an instrument maker, shows architecture by Cesar Manrique and a camel breeder. On Fuerteventura, in addition to livestock farming and the operation of traditional grain mills, nature conservation plays a major role: islanders are committed to preserving the sand dunes, and there is a turtle hatchery. On Lanzarote, countless volcanic eruptions have formed a bizarre lunar landscape. It is a great challenge for the inhabitants to extract the cultivation of food from the karstic, dry soil. And yet they even manage to...

programme.title: mareTV: In Alaskas Fjord World
programme.desc: Gigantic fjords and over 5,000 small islands: In Alaskas south theres a lot of wilderness and little civilization. The region between the capital Juneau and the Canadian border is also known by locals as the "Last Frontier", the last outpost. Michelle Masden, for example, has come to terms with the harsh conditions here. She is the only seaplane pilot in the region. She earns her living with her 65-year-old Beaver: as an air taxi, transport plane and now and then as a rescuer in last necessity. Michelle flies anything and everything: spare parts and food, doctors, hikers and hunters. For the fishermen of southern Alaska she searches for large shoals of fish and guides the captains to...

programme.title: mareTV: Newfoundland - Canadas Eastern Point
programme.desc: In Newfoundland, at the easternmost tip of North America, the landscape is pristine, dramatic, and very sparsely populated. In summer, icebergs occasionally drift along the steep cliffs. When the "Titanic" collided with an iceberg and sank just 300 miles off the coast of Newfoundland in 1912, the last radio messages were picked up in a small wooden hut on the Avalon Peninsula. Today, most Newfoundlanders live on Avalon. There are particularly many seabirds here. In Witless Bay, the newborn puffins are ready for their first descent into the Atlantic. But some stray onto the coastal road, attracted by the lights of the hotels and restaurants. In doing so, they run the risk of being run...

programme.title: mareTV: Peru - Coast of the Incas
programme.desc: Dramatically, the coast plunges into the sea, the so-called Costa of Peru is a gigantic desert on the Pacific Ocean, 2,400 kilometers long. Rugged, bizarre, like from another star. Ancient cultures settled here, the Moche and the Chimú. Later the proud Inca, the self-proclaimed royal people of the Andes, ruled. In the small town of Huanchaco in northern Peru, the fishermen build a new boat every month: from reed. The small ships are called Caballito de Totora (reed horses), because the shape is reminiscent of a horse and the fishermen ride in it kneeling in the waves. About 2,000 years ago, the moche used it to go out to sea. Carlos Segura Azola is a descendant of the moche. He is...

programme.title: mareTV: Mexicos Caribbean Coast
programme.desc: The palm tree laden beaches on Mexicos Riviera Maya on the Yucatan peninsula are endless, and the turquoise sea with its gentle Caribbean surf is a warm 25 degrees during the mild winter in this part of the world. Between Cancún and Punta Allen, where once there was little more than bushland and a few sleepy fishing villages, vibrant life has evolved during the past three decades. Richard Sowa has lived on a floating island for the past 15 years: an island he built himself out of empty plastic bottles. The bon vivant him-self sees it as a "solution for our planets refuse problem". Off Punta Allen, a village in the bay of Sian Kaan, Mexican Mara Coral Ley and her cousin Kim, continue to...

programme.title: mareTV: The Caribbean for explorers: St. Vincent and the Grenadines
programme.desc: Much more Caribbean than on the islands of St. Vincent and the Grenadines is hardly possible. Deserted beaches, uninhabited islands, lush vegetation, the 33 islands in total are dreamlike with extremely hospitable inhabitants. Miranda Phillips runs a laundry and water boat on Bequia. Every morning, the 32-year-old navigates from yacht to yacht with her small bright green service vehicle and is already expected by most skippers. Miranda promises radiantly fresh laundry, which she delivers again the same day. And so there is always something going on in her tiny laundrette in the harbour. It turns into a karaoke bar in the evening, because that is Mirandas great passion. Eban Olliver has...

programme.title: Caribbean sisters: The Lesser Antilles St. Kitts and Nevis
programme.desc: In the centre of the Caribbean, volcanoes rise steeply from the sea, thus shaping the sister islands of St. Kitts and Nevis. Their slopes, covered in lush rainforests, snow-white, sandy beaches and the surrounding tur-quoise tinted waters provide the ultimate setting for this record-breaking, albeit tiny island paradise: Both islets are the smallest of the Caribbean dwarf states and also rank among the world’s ten smallest states. A hot pepper sauce, made of a creative mixture of ginger, garlic, thyme and extraordinarily hot chillies that thrive in the hot and humid climate of Nevis, is simmering on the stove of Violet and Llewellyn’s house. Lemmy Pemberton digs up abandoned turtle nests...

programme.desc: Ever since the embargo was lifted in the summer of 2015, Cuba’s popularity has been steadily increasing.

The bon vivant him-self sees it as a "solution for our planets refuse problem". Off Punta Allen, a village in the bay of Sian Kaan, Mexican Mara Coral Ley and her cousin Kim, continue to...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 The Secret World of Herbs - In India
programme.desc: In India, herbs play an everyday role hardly equalled anywhere in the world. From the tropical green south to the mountains of the northern Himalayas, herbs lend fragrance to joss sticks and soaps, and flavor to the cuisine. And, above all, herbs heal. Six thousand varieties of plants are used in India, and most are harvested in the wild – where they are becoming depleted. The ever rising need for herbal medicine for the subcontinent’s 1.3 billion inhabitants comes on top of the demand of its growing middle class for herbal-based cosmetics. As a result, certain herbs have become scarce, while others have already vanished entirely. Most of the herbs in India are harvested in the wild. The...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 The Secret World of Herbs - In Latin America
programme.desc: Healing effects, fragrance, and intense flavor – the benefits of herbs were discovered by the indigenous peoples of South America long before Spanish conquistadores subdued the continent. Even today, in the remote regions of South America, life without herbs is unthinkable. For many inhabitants, they provide the sole medicine. For more than two thousand years, this wisdom of the healing powers of nature has been passed down from generation to generation. In Bolivia, the film accompanies ethnobiologist Rainer Bussmann on one of his expeditions documenting which herbs the locals use against which illnesses. The German scientist has spent the last 15 years in the region, focussed on...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 The Secret World of Herbs - In the Alps
programme.desc: Secluded for many centuries in inaccessible valleys, the inhabitants of the Alps had no alternative but to rely on the healing powers of nature. A knowledge of herbs was deeply rooted in these mountain-dwellers’ everyday lives – until the twentieth century, when this wisdom became eclipsed by modern academic medicine. Today, Alpine herbs are witnessing a revival, as public interest in regional natural treasures grows. The potential of Alpine herbs is far from exhausted. In the Berchtesgaden Alps, the film shows Hubsi Ilsanker at work as a root-digger, a back-breaking job that has scarcely changed in four hundred years. Authorized by a special historic permit to supply the oldest gentian...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 The Secret world of Herbs - In the Balkans
programme.desc: In the pristine nature and mild climate of southeastern Europe grows a unique diversity of wild plants. Far removed from major industry and polluted soils, the Balkan countries have become the largest exporter of herbs in Europe. In Bulgaria alone, more than 300,000 people work with domestic plants. The business is becoming increasingly lucrative. The film takes us to the Croatian coast. On the Adriatic island of Cres, the audience meets Mladen Dragoslavić. In May, when the sage begins to blossom, this beekeeper has one month to produce his income for an entire year – always with the goal of creating the best sage honey in the Balkans. Given a choice, the bees would never choose sage, for...

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: What ideas are people on the 15th meridian east developing to shape the future and leave tomorrows generations a home worth living in? This consequence leads us to four future designers. From the barren Namib Desert to the glacier worlds of Spitsbergen, Sicily and the Croatian Mediterranean.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 From Generation to Generation
programme.desc: The journey leads from the Norwegian Vesterålen to Chad, the Aeolian Islands and the Polish Giant Mountains. As different as the landscapes and cultures may be, all people are united in their love for their children and their desire to give something to tomorrows generation.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Sow, Harvest, Eat – Our Conservatory
programme.desc: This episode focuses on people from five countries who share a common passion: The production of their own food and food. What culinary treasures are hidden in the different regions, from Spitsbergen to Sweden, Austria, Poland and Chad?

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: Almost 11000 kilometres lie between the northernmost and southernmost point of the 15th meridian east. Here you will find extreme landscapes such as the shimmering heat of Africa or the eternal cold of northern Scandinavia. Five people from Spitsbergen, Namibia, Slovenia, Germany and Poland dedicate their lives to environmental protection.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Wild Life, Gentle Nature
programme.desc: As contrasting as the landscapes of the 15th meridian east, so different are its animal inhabitants. What are the living conditions like in the heat of the Namibian Damaraland, in Lusatia or on the coast of Norway? Which challenges do elephants, whales or kingfishers have to master together with their companions from north to south?

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II
programme.sub-title: S02 : E01 Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II: Gir National Park: India – Asia’s Last Lion
programme.desc: In the far west of India, unexpected predators roam: lions. Living freely in a human-inhabited area without fences, they occasionally prey on the livestock of the indigenous Maldhari people, who nevertheless take pride in sharing their region with these lions—a unique coexistence of humans and predators. In northern Gujarat, desert landscapes dominate, where semi-nomadic communities breed a unique camel breed capable of swimming: Karai camels swim up to 3km daily to mangrove islands for grazing.

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II: Kinabatangan River: Borneo – Forgotten Paradise
programme.desc: In Sabah, northern Borneo, flows the 560km-long Kinabatangan River. Nowhere else in Sabah are wild animals as easily spotted as along this river: orangutans, elephants, crocodiles, and proboscis monkeys. However, biodiversity is threatened as more rainforest gives way to palm oil plantations. Wildlife ventures into inhabited areas in search of food, leading to conflicts. Locals are fighting to preserve the rainforest and its unique wildlife, demonstrating that conservation and prosperity can coexist even in a modern society.

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II
programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II: Pu Mat National Park: Vietnam – Of Bears and Men
programme.desc: The jungle in northern Vietnam is nearly impenetrable, with some areas never touched by humans. The remote rainforests of Pu Mat National Park serve as a refuge for endangered wildlife such as black bears, monkeys, and pangolins. Tuan, a biologist and bear specialist, embarks on an expedition to these untouched regions of the park in search of bears. The most hunted animal here is the pangolin, sought after for its scales believed to have medicinal properties and its meat considered a delicacy. A small Vietnamese conservation organization fights for the survival of this species.

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II: Gaoligongshan Park: China – Himalaya’s Gold
programme.desc: The Great Gobi National Park in southwestern Mongolia shelters one of the last populations of wild Bactrian camels, amid its ancient and mysterious desert landscape. With around 800 critically endangered animals, the Gobi remains one of the worlds most sparsely inhabited and inhospitable regions, yet its allure is undeniable, offering a captivating backdrop for encounters with wild camels and stories of people deeply connected to nature.

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II
programme.sub-title: S02 : E05 Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II: Great Gobi National Park: Mongolia – Following the Wild Camels
programme.desc: The jungle in northern Vietnam is nearly impenetrable, with some areas never touched by humans. The remote rainforests of Pu Mat National Park serve as a refuge for endangered wildlife such as black bears, monkeys, and pangolins. Tuan, a biologist and bear specialist, embarks on an expedition to these untouched regions of the park in search of bears. The most hunted animal here is the pangolin, sought after for its scales believed to have medicinal properties and its meat considered a delicacy. A small Vietnamese conservation organization fights for the survival of this species.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The Secret World of Herbs - In Provence
programme.desc: Its native fragrant flowers and aromatic herbs have made the Provence a brand known worldwide. The wealth of flora found in this region, between the French Alps and the Mediterranean, is unequalled among the French provinces. Around Sault, near Mont Ventoux, the valleys and high plains are carpeted with bright violet: In the hot climate of the South of France, lavender blooms and exudes its fragrance. Monastic healers have been using its aromatic medicinal oil since the Middle Ages. And today an entire industry is based on the trade with this fragrant flower. Yet the livelihood of Provençal lavender farmers is imperiled. In France’s major lavender-growing region, the “Plateau de...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 The Secret World of Herbs - In India
programme.desc: In India, herbs play an everyday role hardly equalled anywhere in the world. From the tropical green south to the mountains of the northern Himalayas, herbs lend fragrance to joss sticks and soaps, and flavor to the cuisine. And, above all, herbs heal. Six thousand varieties of plants are used in India, and most are harvested in the wild – where they are becoming depleted. The ever rising need for herbal medicine for the subcontinent’s 1.3 billion inhabitants comes on top of the demand of its growing middle class for herbal-based cosmetics. As a result, certain herbs have become scarce, while others have already vanished entirely. Most of the herbs in India are harvested in the wild. The...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 The Secret World of Herbs - In Latin America
programme.desc: Healing effects, fragrance, and intense flavor – the benefits of herbs were discovered by the indigenous peoples of South America long before Spanish conquistadores subdued the continent. Even today, in the remote regions of South America, life without herbs is unthinkable. For many inhabitants, they provide the sole medicine. For more than two thousand years, this wisdom of the healing powers of nature has been passed down from generation to generation. In Bolivia, the film accompanies ethnobiologist Rainer Bussmann on one of his expeditions documenting which herbs the locals use against which illnesses. The German scientist has spent the last 15 years in the region, focussed on...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 The Secret World of Herbs - In the Alps
programme.desc: Secluded for many centuries in inaccessible valleys, the inhabitants of the Alps had no alternative but to rely on the healing powers of nature. A knowledge of herbs was deeply rooted in these mountain-dwellers’ everyday lives – until the twentieth century, when this wisdom became eclipsed by modern academic medicine. Today, Alpine herbs are witnessing a revival, as public interest in regional natural treasures grows. The potential of Alpine herbs is far from exhausted. In the Berchtesgaden Alps, the film shows Hubsi Ilsanker at work as a root-digger, a back-breaking job that has scarcely changed in four hundred years. Authorized by a special historic permit to supply the oldest gentian...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 The Secret world of Herbs - In the Balkans
programme.desc: In the pristine nature and mild climate of southeastern Europe grows a unique diversity of wild plants. Far removed from major industry and polluted soils, the Balkan countries have become the largest exporter of herbs in Europe. In Bulgaria alone, more than 300,000 people work with domestic plants. The business is becoming increasingly lucrative. The film takes us to the Croatian coast. On the Adriatic island of Cres, the audience meets Mladen Dragoslavić. In May, when the sage begins to blossom, this beekeeper has one month to produce his income for an entire year – always with the goal of creating the best sage honey in the Balkans. Given a choice, the bees would never choose sage, for...

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: What ideas are people on the 15th meridian east developing to shape the future and leave tomorrows generations a home worth living in? This consequence leads us to four future designers. From the barren Namib Desert to the glacier worlds of Spitsbergen, Sicily and the Croatian Mediterranean.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 From Generation to Generation
programme.desc: The journey leads from the Norwegian Vesterålen to Chad, the Aeolian Islands and the Polish Giant Mountains. As different as the landscapes and cultures may be, all people are united in their love for their children and their desire to give something to tomorrows generation.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Sow, Harvest, Eat – Our Conservatory
programme.desc: This episode focuses on people from five countries who share a common passion: The production of their own food and food. What culinary treasures are hidden in the different regions, from Spitsbergen to Sweden, Austria, Poland and Chad?

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: Almost 11000 kilometres lie between the northernmost and southernmost point of the 15th meridian east. Here you will find extreme landscapes such as the shimmering heat of Africa or the eternal cold of northern Scandinavia. Five people from Spitsbergen, Namibia, Slovenia, Germany and Poland dedicate their lives to environmental protection.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Wild Life, Gentle Nature
programme.desc: As contrasting as the landscapes of the 15th meridian east, so different are its animal inhabitants. What are the living conditions like in the heat of the Namibian Damaraland, in Lusatia or on the coast of Norway? Which challenges do elephants, whales or kingfishers have to master together with their companions from north to south?

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II
programme.sub-title: S02 : E01 Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II: Gir National Park: India – Asia’s Last Lion
programme.desc: In the far west of India, unexpected predators roam: lions. Living freely in a human-inhabited area without fences, they occasionally prey on the livestock of the indigenous Maldhari people, who nevertheless take pride in sharing their region with these lions—a unique coexistence of humans and predators. In northern Gujarat, desert landscapes dominate, where semi-nomadic communities breed a unique camel breed capable of swimming: Karai camels swim up to 3km daily to mangrove islands for grazing.

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II: Kinabatangan River: Borneo – Forgotten Paradise
programme.desc: In Sabah, northern Borneo, flows the 560km-long Kinabatangan River. Nowhere else in Sabah are wild animals as easily spotted as along this river: orangutans, elephants, crocodiles, and proboscis monkeys. However, biodiversity is threatened as more rainforest gives way to palm oil plantations. Wildlife ventures into inhabited areas in search of food, leading to conflicts. Locals are fighting to preserve the rainforest and its unique wildlife, demonstrating that conservation and prosperity can coexist even in a modern society.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Wild Moments: Dangerous and Deadly I
programme.desc: Wildlife film-makers often risk life and limb trying to capture unique images of their dangerous protagonists. In Alaska a cunning grizzly threatens the son of Andreas Kieling, on the remote Wrangel Island in northern-east Siberia his colleague Uwe Anders is taken by surprise by a a polar bear, and off the coast of South Africa a diving-team is unexpectedly surrounded by white sharks. But the life of the film-makers is also threatened by elemental forces, life-threatening diseases and failing technical equipment: Deep in the vast rainforests of West Africa cameraman Klaus Scheurich nearly dies of malaria, and in South India a film team narrowly escapes death in a hot-air balloon accident....

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Wild Moments: Dangerous and Deadly II
programme.desc: Wildlife filmmakers often risk life and limb trying to capture unique images of their dangerous protagonists. A cunning grizzly grabs a salmon off Andreas Kielings fishing rod, in the depths of the Amazon River a diving team has a spooky encounter with piranhas, in the Mediterranean Sea the currents nearly push Thomas Behrend into the mouths of angry sperm whales defending a newborn - and cameramen who want to film jaguars in the dense jungle of South America become easy prey for the well camouflaged cats. The life of the film-makers is also threatened by elemental forces and failing technical equipment: In the swamps of North Australia violent storms hold up the crossing of tearing...

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Wild Moments: Dangerous and Deadly III
programme.desc: Wildlife filmmakers often risk life and limb trying to capture unique images of their dangerous protagonists. In the Kruger National Park Josef Jozefowicz steps into a lionesses den to film her cubs, in Alaska Andreas Kieling mingles with giant elk bulls in order to film them in action, and in Florida his colleague Zoltan Torok gets very close to an alligator mother guarding its nest. The life of the film-makers is also threatened by elemental forces, and failing technical equipment: the strong and tearing current of the Yukon River throws Andreas Kielings boat onto a gravel bank, in the Democratic Republik of Congo camerawoman Heike Grebe is separated from her colleagues in the dense...

programme.title: Victim To Verdict With Ted Rowlands
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Victim To Verdict With Ted Rowlands
programme.desc: During a quiet summer evening in 2017, a woman dials 911 to report her husband is dead on the floor of his snake breeding facility. Lynlee Renick claims she has no idea who shot and killed 29-year-old Ben Renick, a world-renowned snake breeder and father of two. After four years of twists, turns and secrets revealed, Lynlee Renick goes to trial and Court TVs cameras are there for her testimony and a surprising sentence.

programme.title: Notorious Criminals
programme.desc: It was the flying saucer seen round the world. A silver, helium-filled balloon racing across the Colorado sky with a reported stowaway onboard.

programme.title: US Bounty Hunters
programme.desc: Watch as Fred rolls down the hill tackling this guy to the ground, he was not letting this one get away!!...then Denise is stuck with him in her car!

programme.title: US Bounty Hunters
programme.desc: Big Wayne had his reason not to show up to court...he was wearing a special bracelet on his ankle, but house arrest didnt keep him from selling his stuff out of his home.

programme.title: 72 Hours: True Crime
programme.desc: A frat boy lures a girl to his house with the promise of a party, but once there it turns out he has ulterior motives.

programme.title: 72 Hours: True Crime
programme.desc: Three teenagers accompany a deliveryman to a densely wooded area for a drinking party that, before long, becomes a nightmare.

programme.title: 72 Hours: True Crime
programme.desc: A young Orthodox Jewish man is in Pittsburgh to celebrate Passover with family when he is gunned down simply because of the way he is dressed.

programme.title: Someone to Baywatch Over You
programme.desc: Mitch helps a woman he calls “The Mermaid” who turns out to be the wife of a crime boss.

programme.title: K-Gas The Grooveyard of Solid Gold
programme.desc: The Baywatch team is put on high alert when thousands of reckless treasure hunters storm the beach.

programme.title: Red Wind
programme.desc: When the hot Santa Ana winds move in from the desert, things start heating up on the Baywatch beach.

programme.title: I Spike
programme.desc: A lifeguard-turned-hovercraft expert introduces new technology to the Baywatch team.

programme.title: Silent Night Baywatch Night, Part 1
programme.desc: Matt and Hobie rescue a young boy who is being harassed by a thug and take care of him.

programme.title: Silent Night Baywatch Night, Part 2
programme.desc: Joey joins Mitch and Hobie in decorating for Christmas. Father Ryan falls in love with CJ.

programme.title: Rubber Ducky
programme.desc: Logans visa is soon to expire. Can he get his green card before he gets sent back to Australia?

programme.title: Homecoming
programme.desc: Stephanie is kidnapped by an eco-terrorist. The Baywatch team must rescue her and save the day.

programme.title: Seize the Day
programme.desc: Mitch proposes to Tracy, but the happy moment is short-lived as she reveals she is terminal ill.

programme.title: A Little Help From My Friends
programme.desc: Mitch is still mourning Tracy’s death, so Hobie seeks help from a radio show to help Mitch recover.

programme.title: Fathers Day
programme.desc: Mitch receives a mysterious package his father had put together before he died.

programme.title: Fire With Fire
programme.desc: Andy, an old friend of Mitch, visits Baywatch to complete four days of lifeguard service.

programme.title: Deep Trouble
programme.desc: Matt and CJ stumble upon a homeless man who shockingly turns out to be someone they know very well.

programme.title: Promised Land
programme.desc: When testing out a new flying machine, Mitch spots a makeshift raft with a stranded woman in it.

programme.title: The Runaways
programme.desc: Prominent British businessman Richard Branson visits Baywatch to perform several risky stunts.

programme.title: Wet and Wild
programme.desc: Hobie’s idol comes to the beach, but Mitch is furious he turns out to have some questionable morals.

programme.title: Trapped Beneath the Sea, Part 1
programme.desc: Mitch considers a new career working with Garner as a private eye. Logan cheats on Caroline again.

programme.title: Trapped Beneath the Sea, Part 2
programme.desc: When a crippled oil rig sinks and floods with water, the team begins a desperate rescue effort.

programme.title: Hot Stuff
programme.desc: Kaye asks Hobie to volunteer at a school for young blind children.

programme.title: Surfs Up
programme.desc: Cody and Neely rescue two surfers that fall ill due to a highly polluted beach.

programme.title: To Everything There is a Season
programme.desc: Mitchs mother arrives in town and, after some strange occurrences, he insists she see a doctor.

programme.title: Leap of Faith
programme.desc: Stephanie, CJ, and Caroline go on a girls-only junior lifeguard trip to Catalina.

programme.title: Face of Fear
programme.desc: Hobies new friend Isaac’s risky behavior causes problems for the lifeguards.

programme.title: Hit and Run
programme.desc: Logan borrows Codys car without permission and has an accident, then lies to the police.

programme.title: Home is Where the Heat is
programme.desc: Matt returns to Baywatch and ends up trapped on a yacht with Neely and a group of ruthless pirates.

programme.title: Sweet Dreams
programme.desc: Logan and Caroline’s relationship hits a new low when Caroline returns his engagement ring.

programme.title: The Incident
programme.desc: Caroline blames herself for a teens death in a fiery nighttime boating accident and gets PTSD.

programme.title: Beauty and the Beast
programme.desc: A mysterious creature begins attacking beachgoers, and it is up to the Baywatch team to find it.

programme.title: Desperate Encounter
programme.desc: Logan must help his friend raise $50,000 to keep her ranch, and Jessie Lee Harris is back to help.

programme.title: Baywatch Angels
programme.desc: Stephanie, Caroline and CJ become Charlie’s Angels in a fun fantasy romp through 70s television.

programme.title: Bash at the Beach
programme.desc: CJ rescues pro wrestler Hulk Hogan, who is in town with Randy Savage to help save a Youth Center.

programme.title: Freefall
programme.desc: Mitch is convinced by Stephanies boyfriend Tom to go sky-surfing but things go horribly wrong.

programme.title: Sail Away
programme.desc: Stephanie is recruiting lifeguards for the annual Sailing Regatta against South Bay.

programme.title: Lost and Found
programme.desc: Mitch and Caroline rescue a woman who gets amnesia while trying to find her father.

programme.title: Silent Night Baywatch Night, Part 2
programme.desc: Joey joins Mitch and Hobie in decorating for Christmas. Father Ryan falls in love with CJ.

programme.title: Forbidden Paradise, Part 1
programme.desc: The team is invited to Hawaii for a week to oversee new lifeguard techniques and relax a bit.

programme.title: Forbidden Paradise, Part 2
programme.desc: After Matt is stung by a poisonous fish they find a village where a young woman offers to help.

programme.title: Last Wave
programme.desc: Kaye is reunited with old flame Wes Masters. Stephanie undergoes surgery for melanoma.

programme.title: Go for the Gold
programme.desc: While in search of underwater treasure, Stephanie and Cody are confronted by drug smugglers.

programme.title: Shark Fever
programme.desc: Logan decides to write and direct a low-budget action film at the beach using a real shark.

programme.title: The Contest
programme.desc: When Mitch Judges the Miss Malibu Beach Bikini Contest his willpower is tested.

programme.title: Liquid Assets
programme.desc: Max, a secretly rich homeless eccentric man, suddenly dies and leaves CJ his fortune.

programme.title: Promised Land
programme.desc: When testing out a new flying machine, Mitch spots a makeshift raft with a stranded woman in it.

programme.title: Windswept
programme.desc: At the annual Baywatch Bachelor Auction, Mitch is "bought" for $5,000 by a wealthy socialite.

programme.title: Scorcher
programme.desc: LA is in the throes of a severe heat wave! Hundreds of thousands of people head to the beach.

programme.title: Beachblast
programme.desc: Mitch hires MTV DJ Jenny McCarthy to throw "Beachblast" to raise money for the Special Olympics.

programme.title: Guess Whos Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: CJs mother, a former Las Vegas showgirl, arrives in town to get away from her mobster ex-boyfriend.

programme.title: Let the Games Begin
programme.desc: Australias Uncle Tobys International Ironman Competition sparks a battle of the sexes.

programme.title: Buried
programme.desc: Controversy generated by Donnas appearance in Playboy magazine divides the Baywatch lifeguards.

programme.title: Search and Rescue
programme.desc: Fire chief Captain Huntingdon and the Baywatch team form an elite joint Search and Rescue unit.

programme.title: Heal the Bay
programme.desc: The team works with Heal the Bay after a recent rainstorm washes inland pollutants onto the beach.

programme.title: Bachelor of the Month
programme.desc: Mitch has been chosen Flash Magazines Bachelor of the Month, which causes some complications.

programme.title: Chance of a Lifetime
programme.desc: Stephanie and Tom go on their honeymoon in a two-mast schooner with a group of troubled teenagers.

programme.title: Talk Show
programme.desc: Mitch gets his “15 minutes of fame” when he rescues Jay Leno from choking.

programme.title: Life Guardian
programme.desc: Caroline, Neely and Manny rescue three orphan teenage boys from drowning.

programme.title: Matters of the Heart
programme.desc: Manny is haunted by his past when two juvenile delinquents from his hometown arrive at Baywatch.

programme.title: Rendezvous
programme.desc: When a young couple’s romance is threatened by their parents, they make a pact to end their lives.

programme.title: Hot Water
programme.desc: While testing new scuba diving technology, Sam, Neely and Caroline witness a jet crash.

programme.title: Trial by Fire
programme.desc: CJ and Cody transport an injured sea lion to the animal recovery facility at Sea World.

programme.title: Baywatch at Sea World
programme.desc: Caroline finds herself being sued for negligence in civil court by the mother of a drowning victim.

programme.title: Golden Girls
programme.desc: A crazed young woman is causing trouble on the Venice Boardwalk and Neely suspects something is up.

programme.title: Nevermore
programme.desc: A mysterious, disfigured man who the public dubs "the phantom lifeguard," is secretly saving people.

programme.title: Rookie Summer
programme.desc: Lifeguard candidates compete for a chance to attend Rookie School and become Baywatch Lifeguards.

programme.title: Stunt Games
programme.desc: Adan and Samuel, twin brothers who dream of success as cinema stunt men, become entangled with mafia after accepting an obscure assignment.

programme.title: Boone: The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When fame-seeking reality show bounty hunter, Boone, attempts to bring down a drug lord and his empire, he uncovers more than he bargains for.

programme.title: Sam
programme.desc: An alpha New York City male is magically transformed into a beautiful girl, falls in love, and learns what it means to be a woman.

programme.title: Shirin In Love
programme.desc: Love has no borders and therein lies the premise of the charming, Iranian-American romantic comedy "Shirin in Love."

programme.title: Hell and Mr. Fudge
programme.desc: In 1970s Alabama, a young preacher struggles with his faith, and attacks from his church, after being hired to prove whether or not Hell exists.

programme.title: Executor
programme.desc: A ruthless assassin, trained to kill in the name of God by a corrupt priest, re-evaluates his life purpose after saving a little boy from one of his own assassination attempts.

programme.title: The Menkoff Method
programme.desc: In this satirical office comedy introverted bank worker, David Cork, joins forces with corporate gun Ruby Jackson to defeat the evil HR guru – Max Menkoff.

programme.title: The Phoenix Project
programme.desc: Four scientists craft a machine to reanimate deceased organisms.

programme.title: The God Question
programme.desc: A scientist asks an experimental super-intelligent computer the ultimate question: Is there evidence for God, for a spiritual framework to life?

programme.title: Treasure Lies
programme.desc: Hardworking teenager Sean feels let down by life, but faces a crisis of character through a series of his own bad decisions.

programme.title: God and Salsa
programme.desc: A grief-stricken therapist determined to help a suicidal teen regains her faith in the process with the help of her Pastor and Salsa instructor.

programme.title: Crazy
programme.desc: Inspired by the life of Hank Garland, CRAZY is the story of a legendary guitar player who emerged from Nashville in the 1950s.

programme.title: Druid Peak
programme.desc: A troubled teen is sent to live with his estranged father, a park ranger. During his time there, he develops an unusual affinity with and passion for the wolves in a local pack.

programme.title: The Henchman’s War
programme.desc: A deadly mistake sets an introspective henchman on a violent crusade against a mid-level crime boss with demons of his own.

programme.title: Delivered
programme.desc: Newlyweds Morris and Venice start out with the best intentions of a marriage made in heaven.

programme.title: Goodbye, Butterfly
programme.desc: After his five-year-old daughter is murdered, a loving family man becomes convinced that the oddball down the street is guilty.

programme.title: House on Rockingham
programme.desc: A young woman takes up a job as a live in housekeeper and slowly learns the owner may be connected to her sisters disappearance.

programme.title: Family Games
programme.desc: Sloane and her boyfriend Barrett return to her childhood home determined to ruin her father Roans re-marriage. Family secrets surface and give rise to a puzzling future.

programme.title: Fray
programme.desc: A young Marine veteran is facing a new battle back home while struggling through a shattered economy and burdened by the physical and emotional scars of war.

programme.title: Miles To Go
programme.desc: A writer from Los Angeles, who doesnt believe that relationships can last for him, struggles to mend his most recent failed relationship.

programme.title: Heart of Wilderness
programme.desc: On the run in the wilderness, Travis and Aimee navigate icy waters and the secrets they keep.

programme.title: The Boatman
programme.desc: A dedicated border coyote is haunted by the memories of those he failed to help.

programme.title: When We Last Spoke
programme.desc: Two abandoned sisters live with their grandparents in Texas in 1967.

programme.title: The Ribbon
programme.desc: Molly and Tim are happy newlyweds, but an unexpected miscarriage threatens to tear them apart until they meet Kristin, a pregnant homeless girl in need of a family.

programme.title: Bright Sky
programme.desc: A single mother escapes a dark past to a small town. As she begins to build a new life, she comes across an outlaw looking for redemption.

programme.title: The Surrogate
programme.desc: The Surrogate is a contemporary dramedy about a group of Bay Area friends in their early 40s navigating lifes messy moments together.

programme.title: Gold Fools
programme.desc: When a successful family man gets laid off, he leads his friends on a gold panning expedition in the mountains of Sonora, oblivious to what lurks where the water runs real deep.

programme.title: TangerineLAnd
programme.desc: Beth Harris is getting married. The only problem is, she already has a husband; pro-surfer, Sonny Baker.

programme.title: Vincents Vow
programme.desc: A broken 30-year-old man who struggles with commitment, accepts a challenge to "learn what love is before claiming to love someone". The results are certainly not what hed expect.

programme.title: 2 Weeks in Lagos
programme.desc: The film captures the excitement and vibrancy of everyday life in Lagos and reflects the complexity of life in Lagos, a dynamic city where anything is possible in 2 Weeks.

programme.title: Alan and the Fullness of Time
programme.desc: The action-packed story of a boy who receives a calling from God that places him in the crosshairs of those in the government who do not want to see him succeed.

programme.title: Alan and the Rulers of the Air
programme.desc: Alan, a young teen with a calling to help complete the Great Commission finds himself embroiled in courtroom drama and demonic oppression.

programme.title: Harbinger
programme.desc: This fantasy/eco-thriller follows twelve-year-old Mira Gonzaga who has been having terrible dreams.

programme.title: Psychos
programme.desc: Three young women seek revenge against a sadistic predator.

programme.title: Operation Repo: The Movie
programme.desc: Lous daughter is kidnapped by a crazed drug dealer after the crew repossesses his car.

programme.title: Breaking Barbi
programme.desc: A Tinder date gone astray leaves famous fitness selfie queen, Barbi, lost in the wilderness trying to survive despite Homeland Security, alien death rays and zero cell service.

programme.title: I Remember You
programme.desc: Two strangers feel a supernatural connection after being involved in the same accident.

programme.title: Humanities and Geography
programme.desc: A strand devoted to the nature and wildlife of China, the people who lived alongside them, and the great and diverse landscapes with which they all contend.

programme.title: Living China
programme.desc: Real life stories told from the personal perspective. Moving, dramatic, sorrows and joys, expressed emphatically and expressed quietly. Watch closely to see and understand the real China as it is lived.

programme.title: Special Edition
programme.desc: Prestige Chinese documentary production, tackling serious subjects with the best cinematography, editing, and all round production values with a unique Chinese perspective.

programme.title: Journeys and Discoveries
programme.desc: A documentary series showcasing the history of China and its people.

programme.title: History in the Frame
programme.desc: A documentary series featuring historical and archaeological exploration.

programme.desc: Food connects people! A feast for the eyes that spotlights the cuisines of China in a way that’s bound to set the mouths of the whole globe watering!

programme.desc: The youth of a country is the future of that country. A series of documentaries focusing on the younger generation of China in which you get to see what they are achieving and what makes them tick!

programme.desc: A well-crafted collage of selected short documentaries telling stories about all aspects of China! People, technology, culture, and wildlife, all are showcased in Internet-friendly form.

programme.title: The World Today

programme.title: The Agenda
programme.desc: A weekly talk-show looking beyond the headlines and “accepted wisdom” to find the real story. Hosted by award-winning journalist and presenter Stephen Cole, The Agenda quite simply sets The Agenda . You won’t find the same-old talking heads recycling platitudes; instead thought-provoking guests to debate and explore key issues of today’s world. Using virtual reality graphics to bring subjects to life, Stephen will navigate through subjects ranging from “Prove That Climate Change Exists” to “Who Will Win the Race to Space”. programme.desc: An officer attempts to pull over a man on a bicycle who refuses to stop. An officer arrests two suspects involved in a drug deal who attempt to discard the evidence. An officer questions a driver leaving a known drug area.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A fleeing suspect takes officers on a wild chase through oncoming traffic. Surveillance footage of a stabbing helps police find the vicious attacker. Cops track a subject into an uncooperative stranger’s apartment.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S26 : E11 This Man Stabbed Me
programme.desc: A car thief leads police on a high-speed chase until officers pit his vehicle to end the pursuit. Cops cool off a baby and search for the man who left him in a car. Potty-mouthed witnesses inform officers that their friend has been stabbed in the chest.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S27 : E28 Tell it to My Wife
programme.desc: A man’s wife can’t help him stay out of jail no matter how much he calls for her. One thief tries to give back his stolen loot. When approached by officers, a woman goes from passed out to out of control.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A stolen vehicle pursuit ends in a take down and recovery of additional evidence. A store employee flags down an officer who steps in to make a theft related arrest. An officer is accompanied by several units in pursuit of a stolen vehicle.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A dispute inside a nightclub turns into a street fight. A man patrols his neighborhood ‘Old West’ style. A K-9 unit is called in to track a burglar on the run.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Police work a sting that targets drug dealers. An undercover sting discovers narcotics trafficking. Police respond to a burglary in progress and discover a flop house.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S23 : E20 Now Its Lawn Furniture
programme.desc: A traffic stop over a broken brake light turns into a foot chase. A man handles bad news by throwing his furniture out of the window. A vehicle pursuit ends with a K-9 unit’s help.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A couple flees a routine traffic stop. An intoxicated woman climbs a tree. Construction workers are pulled over for a hand-to-hand transaction.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers break up a fight between a couple in the middle of the street. Not even a church is immune to being robbed. A dispute between neighbors involves deadly weapons.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers wrestle an uncooperative driver to the ground after a traffic stop. Deputies search for a man who sent threatening texts to his ex-girlfriend. Two suspects are caught stealing gas.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A man can bail on child support payments, but can’t escape the police. One woman’s retaliation almost gets her girlfriend run over. A sluggish suspect denies the pile of marijuana in his car is his.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A sizable amount of cocaine is seized during a routine search. An officer responds to a domestic dispute call with conflicting stories. An officer’s patrol car is nearly struck by a train.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A cyclist gets booked for trying to split when officers pull him over for a traffic violation. Two brothers struggle to explain why they took off in their truck when they saw the cops. A man takes a swing at his sister because she refuses to mow the lawn.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A feisty cyclist gives a team of officers a bloody fight. A scared caregiver attempts to evict an unwanted helper from her patient’s house. Mysterious tinfoil lands an unlicensed driver in hot water.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers engage in a foot pursuit after the passenger of a suspicious vehicle starts running. A man barricades himself in the house after stabbing his nephew. A teenager is caught ditching school to smoke marijuana.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S13 : E19 One for the Road
programme.desc: A man crashes his vehicle after losing control while attempting to evade the police. An elderly woman with an outstanding DUI warrant is arrested for hit and run. Officers discover methamphetamine while investigating two suspicious vehicles on the side of the road.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A driver takes several units on a reckless journey driving on the wrong side of the highway. Officers set up a reverse sting operation to capture a suspected drug dealer.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S21 : E35 My BFF Screwed Up
programme.desc: Officers respond to a call of a woman holding a loaded gun to her head. Officers kick in a door to halt an assault in progress. A woman driving a stolen vehicle claims it was purchased by a friend.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A man in New Jersey is arrested for possession. A couple is pulled over while looking to score. A routine traffic stop turns into a fruitful drug bust.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers investigate two vehicles involved in an accident. Officers respond to a call involving a man with a knife. Officers respond to a call involving a man with a gun at a convenience store.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A vehicle is caught traveling in the opposite direction. A sting operation is designed to nab suspects who purchase narcotics. Officers respond to a shoplifting call at a local thrift store.

programme.desc: Officers are involved in a high-speed pursuit of suspected larcenists. Officers give a driver a sobriety test. Officers report to a call of a dispute in a neighborhood.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S14 : E31 Bruised But Not Broken
programme.desc: Deputies assist an injured woman who vows revenge on her male attackers. A woman tells Deputies her husband beat her in front of their children. Officers protect an elderly woman from an abusive child.

programme.desc: A stolen vehicle investigation results in a brief foot chase and subsequent arrest. A driver is pulled over and is arrested for the possession of a controlled substance. While on patrol an officer spots an distressed man inside a vehicle with busted windows.

programme.desc: Police investigate an attempted robbery that turned deadly. Officers enlist a K9 unit to flush out a suspect. A high-speed chase comes to an end when the suspect crashes into a fence.

programme.desc: A man leads Officers on a pursuit across county lines. An Officer assists in an undercover sting to capture drug dealers. An Officer finds a gun in a suspects car.

programme.desc: Officers respond after two men kick in a womans door. Three suspects attempt to steal a bicycle in an alley. An officer arrests a husband for domestic abuse.

programme.sub-title: S26 : E19 You Didnt Get Very Far
programme.desc: A husky cyclist takes a spill when he tries to flee. Officers chase a suspect in a stolen car who says he was just fixing it for a friend. A mans denials of drug use lose credibility when cops find a meth pipe in his vehicle

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Two cousins fight over a five dollar debt. Police arrest a man for domestic violence. A taxi cab driver is robbed and shot.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Witnesses of a car burglary assist an officer in locating the suspect. An officer investigates a fight involving a young man and a homeless gentleman. A suspect’s testimony is debunked after an eyewitness confirms that his knife wounds were self-inflicted.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Deputies respond to a fight between a daughter’s boyfriend and her mother. A woman lights candles after an attempted break-in. Police respond when an evicted tenant tries to reenter his old apartment.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A man rams his wife’s car into his daughter’s car. Deputies find a rifle in a suspect’s car that was in a prior altercation. A man claims to run a travel business after deputies find evidence of id theft.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A man stages a sit-in in his car in an attempt to stop it from being towed. A homeowner denies that he’s selling drugs despite the large amount of evidence found in his home. A safe full of evidence is found during a traffic stop.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers pursue a man who attempted to cash a bad check then fled the scene. Police are called when a man’s ex-girlfriend breaks into his house. Police chase an unlicensed teen speeding in a vehicle

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers respond after a bloody man is seen prowling around an apartment complex. Officers pull over a suspicious vehicle. Police seize drugs and a large knife from a bicyclist.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: The boat unit contends with an unruly suspect and his equally unpredictable dogs. Two burglary suspects try to claim car trouble when theyre found at the scene of the crime. A repentant meth addict is caught by officers on the brink of his latest relapse.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A jaywalker with no ID bolts away from an officer. A man mixes illicit items with his pizza. A woman involved in a domestic violence call blames her monthly issues.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Several squad cars join together in pursuit of a pickup truck. Officers conduct a drug raid utilizing percussion grenades. A suspect wanted for numerous robberies flees from Police in a sports car.

programme.title: Cops

programme.sub-title: S23 : E11 First Do No Harm
programme.desc: A suicidal man tries to taunt police into shooting him. Undercover officers expose an illegal operation at a pain management clinic. A woman claims she’s just a bystander to a motorcycle hit and run.

programme.title: Scarlet Street
programme.desc: A man in mid-life crisis befriends a young woman, her fiance persuades her to con him.

programme.title: D.O.A.
programme.desc: Frank Bigelow, told hes been poisoned and has only a few days to live, tries to find who killed him and why.

programme.title: Missing Persons
programme.desc: As we meet the characters, Johnny investigates a case of a little Polish girl snatched on a subway train, Carlos tries to find a 14 year old victim of sexual abuse, Bobby searches for a missing law student, and Connie gets frustrated because she isnt given any cases.

programme.title: Missing Persons
programme.sub-title: S01 : E13 Ive Got A Siren!...
programme.desc: Connie helps a girl who is having a baby and is missing her boyfriend, while Bobby meets an actress who models herself on Lauren Bacall and has driven her husband away with her constant role-playing games.

programme.title: Missing Persons
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Im Gonna Miss Him Too...

programme.title: Wiseguy
programme.desc: Santana learns the details of Guzmans money laundering operation and comes face to face with the drug lord who cost him his job as a Federal prosecutor.

programme.title: Wiseguy
programme.desc: Street-wise undercover Federal agent Vinnie Terranova is released from prison after serving a false rap.

programme.title: Wiseguy
programme.desc: Vinnies resignation from the Organized Crime Bureau leads him home and into a hotbed of racial hatred.

programme.title: Wiseguy
programme.sub-title: S03 : E02 Battle Of The Barge
programme.desc: When Cerrico and Tommy Chin tangle over rights to the carting business in Chinatown, Vinnie has to balance his undercover role as a mobster with his responsibiltiy to the OCB.

programme.title: Wiseguy
programme.desc: Vinnie goes undercover for the OCB as a garment-center security consultant to keep the new wave of organized crime leadership from destroying a father-and-son business.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Hanson and Penhall pose as battling brothers to infiltrate a gang of kids from the wrong side of the tracks.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S02 : E20 Best Years Of Your Life
programme.desc: Penhall recounts painful memories of his mothers suicide when a youth hes investigating takes his own life.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S02 : E16 Orpheus 3.3 / The Convenience Killer
programme.desc: Hanson stalks a ruthless killer to avenge the cold-blooded murder of his girlfriend.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: A 16-year-old turns tricks for home security codes, leading Ioki on a trail of burglary and prostitution.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: The Jump Street gang may lose Judy Hoffs when she falls for a guy on the wrong side of the law.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On May 17th 2005, a body is discovered in a forest of Sucy-en-Brie; Christophe Belle, 40 years old, a renowned pastry cook.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The disturbing missing case in Paris of a four year old.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On October 13th 1996, the body of young Angelique Dumetz, 18 years old, is recovered down a ditch in Oise forest. An important clue is found on the crime scene.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On February 23th 2017, policemen are alerted of the disapearrance of Brigitte Troadec, her husband Pascal, and their children Sebastien and Charlotte.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A Night of Horror at Devils Plateau (Marie-Jeanne Meyer Case) - On June 18, 2011, Marie-Jeanne Meyer, 17-years old, waved goodbye to her little sister before leaving for her daily jog on the heights of Tournon in Ardèche. She never came back. Three days later, her mutilated body was found in a freshly dug pit, near an area known to be cursed, "The Devils Plateau." Whats more, the crime scene looked like a mystical ritual ... Was it a ritual murder? Revenge? An unfortunate encounter? ...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A Mysterious Murder at the Farm (Valerie Bary Case)- On Friday, March 26, 2004, in the region of Dijon, Laurent Bary came home from his work to discover the lifeless body of his wife, Valerie, bathing in a pool of blood. According to the investigators initial findings, the 38-year-old nurses aid had been stabbed several times, seeming to validate the theory of a robbery gone wrong.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On July 13, 2011, two boaters retrieved a suitcase that was floating in the bay of Lorient. Inside, they discovered the tied up corpse of a man.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Bloody Christmas next to the Leman lake (CASE OF RUTH LÉGERET) - On January 4, 2006, Ruth Legeret was found dead in the middle of a pool of blood at her luxurious property in Vevey, Switzerland. Next to her was the lifeless body of her friend, Marina Studer. Who could have killed these two simple and wealthy widows? Clue after clue, the Swiss polices investigation would revolve around an environment of family jealousy and financial greed.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: September 16 2005. The lifeless body of Audrey Jouannet, 24, is found hidden under the bed in her small apartment in Soisy-sur-Seine. It soon becomes apparent that the young woman has been tortured at length before being strangled. But surprisingly, though the highly meticulous murderer has taken care to leave no sign of his passage, the autopsy reveals traces of sperm on the victim. It will take all of the investigators intuition to pierce the mystery of this heinous crime...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Sylvain Dromard finds the body of his wife Laurence lying in a pool of blood in the kitchen. The crime was particularly violent and the theory of a burglary that went wrong is soon excluded. But investigators dont understand who could want the adorable hairdresser of Saint-Martin-dAblois dead. During the investigation, the work of profilers will enable them to draw a very precise portrait of the murderer...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: After an ordinary dinner, Pierre and Gabrielle Labrell suffer severe abdominal pains.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Nelly Cremel, 39, leaves her home to go jogging... never to return. Eight days later, after a vast search campaign, her body is found. Theres no doubt that its murder. The case soon ignites public opinion, even inflaming passions at the highest level of the state. The clues lead investigators on a number of trails, from the shadows of the French secret service to a manhunt for a possible sex maniac, in a case of murder most foul.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Willy Pomonti, a retired architect, is found savagely murdered in his opulent villa in La Celle-Saint-Cloud, near Paris. It soon becomes clear that the man has been tortured prior to death. At several points during this extraordinary enquiry, police will feel theyre holding the culprit... It will take them ten years to finally shed light on this particularly violent crime.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The lifeless body of Christophe Lejard is found by his son just metres from their home. The man was shot in the head as he was getting into his car to go to work. A veritable execution, which at first glance doesnt square with the profile of the quiet family man. Yet behind the appearances, the investigation gradually reveals all the hate and resentment that revolved around the victim.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A man walks into a gendarmerie near Saint-Malo to report that his wife has been missing since the previous day. The couple are going through a divorce, but this mother would never have left her seven children alone! An extensive search is undertaken but the woman cannot be found. What has happened to Adeline Piet? The investigation spans several years and experiences many twists.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The corpse of Priscillia Ciatti, 14, is discovered by the side of a field, a few hundred metres from her family home. The teenager has been stabbed sixty times with a knife and -an extra sordid detail - a devil mask is found next to her body. Was Priscillia the victim of a prowler? A serial killer? A maniac inspired by a horror movie? Investigators soon find that the young girl felt she was being watched, and even threatened...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: In the early hours of the morning, Mathilde Croguennec, 18, attending "Teknival" in Brittany, is found at the foot of a tree with her throat cut. Investigators face the task of finding the killer from among the 43,000 participants of this huge open-air festival of electronic music, where drink and drugs are consumed in abundance. An unusual investigation that leads the police down a number of false avenues.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Arriving at her work, the secretary of a small firm in the suburbs of Geneva finds the body of Jean-Raymond Blatti, the companys new accountant. The man is lying in a pool of blood and, on his belly, the murderer has written "DIRTY RAPIST". Yet Jean-Raymond Blatti was never charged with sexual assault. Over the course of the investigation, this inscription will appear as one of the many mysteries of this case which is particularly rich in twists and turns.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On July 19th 2004, the naked and tied up body of a woman is recovered in the Ourcq canal in Fresnes-sur-Marne. The victim is impossible to identify.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On April 3th 2003, Chantal Ternik, a 48 year old housewife, is discovered hanged in her house of Sanary-sur-Mer, in Var.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On March 28th 2013, the burnt body of Anne Barbot, 38 years old, is discovered in a forest of Maine-et-Loire.

programme.title: Peter Manuel - The Beast of Birkenshaw
programme.desc: Peter Manuel was a serial killer who killed at least 8 people in Scotland. He sensationally defended himself in court. But his mother’s testimony proved to be crucial.

programme.title: Mary Ann Cotton - The Black Widow
programme.desc: The Black Widow is a tale of classic Victorian murder. Cotton traveled around England marrying lonely men got them to take out life insurance and then murdered them.

programme.title: Buck Ruxton -The Jigsaw Murders
programme.desc: Dr. Ruxton was an Indian-born physician. He lived a respectable life but had a violent jealous streak. He beat, strangled and stabbed his wife and housemaid.

programme.title: The Shepherd’s Bush Murders
programme.desc: 3 police officers were murdered in Shepherds Bush in 1966. After the killing, they went on the run and a manhunt ensued. One assailant survived 3 months on the run.

programme.title: Ruth Ellis
programme.desc: Ruth Ellis was the last woman to be hanged in Great Britain. Her act of murder divided the nation.

programme.title: Peter Manuel - The Beast of Birkenshaw
programme.desc: Peter Manuel was a serial killer who killed at least 8 people in Scotland. He sensationally defended himself in court. But his mother’s testimony proved to be crucial.

programme.desc: The Black Widow is a tale of classic Victorian murder. Cotton traveled around England marrying lonely men got them to take out life insurance and then murdered them.

programme.title: The Vikings: Origin of the Vikings
programme.desc: From the ice fields of the North to the Russian steppe, these fearsome Scandinavian warriors sailed the globe for three centuries spreading their net of trade and pillage

programme.title: The Vikings: Early Viking Society and Religion
programme.desc: In this episode, we learn how early Viking society developed, what the sacred rituals really were, and what role women played in Viking religion.

programme.title: The Vikings: The Ships of the Vikings
programme.desc: Ships carried Nordic warriors all the way from their Scandinavian homes to lands of conquest. How were these ergonomic ships built and what made them so special?

programme.title: The Vikings: Weapons of the Vikings
programme.desc: The Vikings were fighting machines, plundering lands from central Asia to North America and defeated the armies of the greatest empires. What was their secret?

programme.title: JFK: Fact and Fable
programme.desc: Television made John Kennedy the ultimate celebrity during his presidency. However, the JFK we remember is the one his wife, Jackie, created after his death.

programme.title: Presidents In Crisis
programme.desc: Before they led America through national crises, Presidents Abraham Lincoln, Franklin Roosevelt and Lyndon Johnson were all transformed by personal trauma. Historian Doris Kearns Goodwin reveals the all too human men who became legends.

programme.title: The Hunt for the Slave Ship Guerrero
programme.desc: A team of underwater archeologists searches for the remains of the Guerrero, an illegal slave ship sunk in battle off the coast of Florida.

programme.title: MIA: Hunt for a WWII Plane
programme.desc: Ex-CIA agent Ben Smith and a retired FBI officer journey through the Jungles of Burma in search of answers to a family mystery.

programme.title: The Last Persian Shah
programme.desc: Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi would have been 100 years in October 2019. The Shahs story begins with good ideas and ideals and ends in bloody chaos.

programme.title: Connecting To The Future
programme.desc: Host Derek Muller escorts us to the physical heart of the Internet, and demonstrates how Internet co-creators Vint Cerf and Bob Kahn devised a language.

programme.title: Man Vs. Machine
programme.desc: We peer inside "The Internet of Things" and reveal how web advertising, search engines and 24/7 surveillance have transformed our lives.

programme.title: Guardians Of The Web
programme.desc: Muller introduces viewers to "white" hackers, the U.S. Secret Service’s cybercrime division including West Point soldiers working to protect us from the Web.

programme.title: Mathemagics
programme.desc: Arthur Benjamin amazes with his ability to "do math in his head" and to work with numbers, and shows us the underlying patterns in mathematics ... but can he play poker?

programme.title: Rapidly Evolving Human with Spencer Wells
programme.desc: Renowned geneticist and author Spencer Wells reveals how changes in our genetic code have fueled major changes in our appearance and capabilities over time.

programme.title: Transcontinental Railroad
programme.desc: The Americans who settled the west, those icons of freedom and independence, lived at the mercy of the railroad tycoons.

programme.title: Cold War
programme.desc: The Cold War was won not by weapons of war, but blue jeans, silk stockings, and fast food. Just follow the money.

programme.title: Civil War
programme.desc: Why, as a teenager in New Jersey in the 1980s, was Peter Sagal taught the Southern myth of the Civil War? Slaves = money = power.

programme.title: Watergate
programme.desc: Like a burger and fries, Nixon and scandal have always gone together. But why did his men break into the Watergate office building? Why did Nixon crave personal wealth?

programme.title: John Doy and the Immortal 10
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: John Doy is arrested along the Underground Railroad, but his friends are determined to set him free.

programme.title: Breaking out of Libby Prison
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: A band of POWs held in the Confederate capital attempt the Civil War’s largest prison escape.

programme.title: Pauline Cushman: Tales of a Yankee Spy
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: When actress and Union spy Pauline Cushman is captured, her performance skills offer her a way out.

programme.title: Rebel Raid in Vermont
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: Confederate raiders attack a small town in Vermont. A local posse tries to cut off their escape.

programme.title: Robert Smalls: Steamboat to Freedom
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: Robert Smalls is enslaved, but he has the skills and the nerve to sail a rebel ship to freedom.

programme.title: Into the Rebel Swamp
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: Wallace Turnage was born a slave. He made multiple escape attempts. But on his sixth - and final - attempt, he endured a genuine odyssey.
